newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat up modestly on technicals, weather.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat up modestly on technicals, weather.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures rose moderately on Friday amid technically-related buying, traders said.
This is a technical bounce after Thursday's sharply lower close," one trader said. "The strong selling yesterday (Thursday) drove us down."

But traders cited several other determining factors which include snow in the Texas Panhandle on Friday with more expected as the day unfolds, a Pakistan wheat tender and spillover support from CBOT soybeans.
They also noted little hedge pressure at the opening.
Volume was moderate, a trader said.

Snow fell in the Texas Panhandle early Friday and forecasts called for nearly a foot of snow in that region which could further damage wheat already hit by recent freezing weather, Weather Services Corp said.
At 0953 CDT, KCBT July wheat rose three cents to bid at $4.48 a bushel while the rest of the board was eight cents up to minues five cents.
